Historical Councils
Historical Town Councils
Ever wonder how Horseshoe Beach became the place it is today? Our Town Councils have helped shape our community by bringing in paved streets, maintained canals, clean and reliable water, and ensuring every citizen has a voice in our political process.

Note: Mayor Sammy Corbin assigned oversight roles to each council member in 1989. Oversight roles would be assigned somewhat sporadically on an as-needed basis by future councils. The oversight role of each councilmember is reflected in smaller print below their service term(s).

Jeff Williams
Councilmember 2021-2022

Mayor Williams has served on town council since 2021.
Mayor Williams is responsible for
town finance
and
Municode
, as well as directing town council meetings.

Information on this page is presented as a public service of Town of Horseshoe Beach, Florida. Town of Horseshoe Beach, Florida does not assume any responsibility for content on any externally linked pages, and we disclaim all liability for linked pages. Every effort is made to ensure the accuracy of the information at the time it is posted, but due to the changing nature of information over time, accuracy cannot be guaranteed. Website visitors are encouraged to consult with the Town of Horseshoe Beach officials and employees to confirm the accuracy, reliability and timeliness of the information posted on the website. The Town of Horseshoe Beach shall not be liable for errors contained herein or for any damages in connection with the use of the information contained on the website.
Contact Us
Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing:
Phone: 352-498-5234
US Mail: PO Box 86, Horseshoe Beach, FL 32648

Upcoming Events
Horseshoe Beach's own
Friends in the Shoe
Event Committee sponsors and runs events in Horseshoe Beach year-round. From holiday celebrations to fishing tournaments and fireworks, few months in Horseshoe go by without an event.
Savvy Citizen
provides up-to-date events and notifications for residents. Whether you're a lifelong resident or a weekend visitor, you can see our upcoming calendar below!
